Is it possible to change the part config file of the wobbly decoupler/fairing to allow me to connect struts to it? By default I can't connect struts to or from it, and that wobble literally makes it impossible to get the thing above 30 km without it entering a massive spin. Plus it generally ends up violently ripping one of the sky-crane's engines off.

Is it possible to change the part config file of the wobbly decoupler/fairing to allow me to connect struts to it? By default I can't connect struts to or from it, and that wobble literally makes it impossible to get the thing above 30 km without it entering a massive spin. Plus it generally ends up violently ripping one of the sky-crane's engines off.

You can change it by your self: Open the KSP folder, open Part folder, open LH_CapsuleDecoupler folder, open the part.cfg file with a text editor, replace this line 

attachRules = 1,0,1,0,0

by this line: 

attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0

I'll change it in the next update.

I noticed that when I crash with the rover, the report lists 3 kerbonaughts were killed. I skimmed the previous pages but is this a "manned" rover for anyone else?

I noticed that when I crash with the rover, the report lists 3 kerbonaughts were killed. I skimmed the previous pages but is this a "manned" rover for anyone else?

Put this under "pod/rcs parameters" in the config for the rover command pod:

// --- internal setup ---

CrewCapacity = 0

INTERNAL

{

name = GenericSpace1

}

OP should do this too. Makes 'em unmanned.
